instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-00165: What is 820-00165? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.PPBUS_G3H: What is PPBUS_G3H? Main system power rail that charges the battery, or is power from the battery, that everything else is powered from. .
definitions.PP3V42_G3H: What is PP3V42_G3H? PP3V42_G3H is a power rail present when the machine is in a G3H global system hardware off state and is the first rail that should be generated in Macbooks that use it. .
definitions.PP5V_S5: What is PP5V_S5? This is a 5v power rail that is present when the machine is in an S5 soft off state..
definitions.PP5V_S0: What is PP5V_S0? PP5V_S0 is a 5v power rail present when the system is in an S0 working state..
definitions.PPVRTC_G3H: What is PPVRTC_G3H? PPVRTC_G3H is a 3.3v power rail for the RTC circuit present when the machine is in a G3H global system hardware off state. .
definitions.PP5V_S4RS3: What is PP5V_S4RS3? PP5V_S4RS3 is a 5v power rail present when the machine is in an S4 suspend to disk state..
definitions.PPBUS_S5_HS_COMPUTING_ISNS: What is PPBUS_S5_HS_COMPUTING_ISNS? This power rail is PPBUS_G3H after going through a current sense resistor that sits between PPBUS_G3H & the input of PPBUS_G3H to circuitry that provides power for the CPU..
definitions.PPDCIN_G3H_ISOL: What is PPDCIN_G3H_ISOL? This is the voltage coming directly from the charger after going through a transistor. .
definitions.PPBUS_S5_HS_OTHER_ISNS: What is PPBUS_S5_HS_OTHER_ISNS? This is PPBUS_G3H after passing through a current sense resistor that splits it off from the rest of PPBUS_G3H. The purpose of this is so that we can measure how much current is flowing to this part of the machine..
definitions.PPVCC_S0_CPU: What is PPVCC_S0_CPU? The "PPVCC_S0_CPU" power rail is responsible for supplying power to the CPU when the MacBook is fully on, or in the S0 state. This rail is one of the main voltages that the CPU requires for operation. .

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A constant orange light no fan
threads.message:
<SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL> - 2.11
<SIGNAL>PPBUS_S5_HS_COMPUTING_ISNS</SIGNAL> -2.10
<SIGNAL>PPBUS_S5_HS_OTHER_ISNS</SIGNAL> - 2.11
<SIGNAL>PPDCIN_G3H_ISOL</SIGNAL> - 19.98 for a sec the 0 every time
<SIGNAL>PP3V42_G3H</SIGNAL> - 3.42
<SIGNAL>PPVRTC_G3H</SIGNAL> - 3.42
<SIGNAL>PP5V_S5</SIGNAL> - 2.08
<SIGNAL>PP5V_S4RS3</SIGNAL> - 0
<SIGNAL>PP5V_S0</SIGNAL> - 0.25

CPU is burning.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A constant orange light no fan
threads.message: Shorted upper side mosfet on <SIGNAL>PPVCC_S0_CPU</SIGNAL> line and most of the time dead CPU.... Measure in diode mode <TRANSISTOR>Q7310</TRANSISTOR> and <TRANSISTOR>Q7320</TRANSISTOR>, replace the shorted one and pray for the CPU be still alive...

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A constant orange light no fan
threads.message: Replaced them both but stil CPU heated orange lightband no life..

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A constant orange light no fan
threads.message: Voltage on <SIGNAL>PPVCC_S0_CPU</SIGNAL> and <SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL> after mosfte replacement??
